action.action-desc: Ms. Lummis (for herself, Ms. Hassan, Mr. Barrasso, and Mrs. Shaheen) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To limit the closure or consolidation of any United States Postal Service processing and distribution center in States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Postal Operations Stay Timely and Local Act or the POSTAL Act.

section.header: Limitation on closing or consolidating Postal Service processing and distribution centers in States

paragraph.text: The term processing and distribution center means a central mail facility thatâ€”

subparagraph.text: distributes and dispatches part or all of both incoming mail and outgoing mail for a designated service area;
provides instructions on the preparation of collection mail, dispatch schedules, and sorting plan requirements to mailers; and
is a sectional center facility, a general mail facility, or a dedicated mail processing facility without a station or branch.

paragraph.text: The term State means a State or the District of Columbia.

subsection.text: The United States Postal Service may not close, consolidate, downgrade, or take any other similar action with respect to a processing and distribution center in a State if such action would result in there being no processing and distribution center located in that State.
